{"step_by_step_thinking": "The first maxillary molar is the tooth located laterally (away from the midline of the face) from both the maxillary second premolars of the mouth but medially (toward the midline of the face) from both maxillary second molars. Its shape is often described as rhomboid because it has four sides that resemble a diamond or rhomboid shape when viewed from the occlusal (biting) surface.", "answer_choice": "A. Rhomboid"}
